2/11 I've directly & personally introduced over 150 people to #bitcoin, either face to face or online. I've have run my "Introduction to #bitcoin" webinar in some form or other 37 times over the year (including publicly & privately to companies, universities & organizations) ...

4/11 I've had the absolute pleasure of working with @lunoglobal on the #bitcoinpioneer project where we now have over 150 fabulous #bitcoin pioneers across the UK giving out #bitcoin for free & setting people up. It's a wonderful community & I love being part of it.

7/11 My @Medium articles have been read well over 100,000 times with a 100% curation rate. Some of my work has been referenced by #bitcoin giants like @saylor & @PeterMcCormack. Much of this is thanks to people like @zulierane who helped me so much in the early days.

Started @ ing great people who've done a great job spreading understanding & adoption of #Bitcoin in '22.
Realised it was too long & got paranoid I'd miss people out.
So deleted the lot.
Instead going with: 
"Keep doing what you're doing lovely people. You know who you are" #HNY https://t.co/18asL24d1L

3/11 .. & have now directly presented to over 3000 people, many of whom also went on to start their own #bitcoin journeys. (The next one is here by the way, you're welcome to join:) https://t.co/QAyqFbEyLz

1/11 As we sign off for this year, I know it's been a difficult one for many of us, but also very rewarding! For me, 2021 has been all about spreading the adoption & education of #bitcoin ... Here's a thread with the numbers & some heartfelt thank yous!

5/11 .. & that small (but rapidly growing) group has so far succeeded in getting *another* 3,000 people started on their Bitcoin journeys! (anyone can join BTW, for info go here: https://t.co/k0q2D1MEcI)

@RaoulGMI @WClementeIII I'm not seeing this. In terms of accumulation (and not on-chain volume) retail is slightly stronger in relative terms. Meanwhile institutional flows are smaller in scale than pre-May, where they were net sellers. They were moderate net buyers Aug/Oct, then sellers Nov/Dec.

@WClementeIII @RaoulGMI For retail interest I’m referring to their relative rate of accumulation. 

There’s been changes impacting L1 on-chain volume over that period to note:

1) large spike in Segwit adoption, was responsible for fees drop.

2) LN growth, particularly apps like Strike to stack sats.

I do agree that the way bitcoiners talk about scarcity is questionable. any amount of bitcoin would be sufficient, because it's infinitely divisible (satoshis are just a way to render a continuous quantity discrete).

but what matters is how much of the world's wealth or purchasing power we choose to allocate to bitcoin. since that's nonzero, no matter how you divide it up, the units have value. the mode of division is irrelevant.

@MrV_777 yeah regardless of how we divide it up, there is a fixed quantity of Bitcoin in the world, we can say there's 1 unit of Bitcoin (with arbitrary divisions). it's just a question of how much of the world's wealth we allocate to that 1 unit
